sen.j: 浮世草子（うきよぞうし）は、江戸時代に生まれた前期近世文学の主要な文芸形式のひとつ。
sen.e: Ukiyo Zoshi is one of the major literary forms in the early Kinsei Bungaku (Japanese Edo period literature.

sen.cmt: ピリオドを挿入しました。

sen.j: 井原西鶴の『好色一代男』（1682年刊行）以降の一連の作品を、それまでの仮名草子とは一線を画するものとして、今日では浮世草子と呼ぶ（当時は「草双紙」と呼ばれ、「仮名草子」・「浮世草子」はのちになって区別されたもの）。
sen.e: A series of works including and after "Koshoku ichidai otoko" (Life of an amorous man) (published in 1682) of Saikaku IHARA are called Ukiyo Zoshi today as works which made a clear departure from then existing Kana Zoshi (book stories written in kana) (it was then called 'Kusa Zoshi' (illustrated story books), 'Kana Zoshi'/ 'Ukiyo Zoshi' separation was made later).

A series of works starting with "Koshoku ichidai otoko" (Life of an amorous man, published in 1682) by Saikaku IHARA are called Ukiyo Zoshi today, as works which made a clear departure from then existing Kana Zoshi (stories written in kana), which were then called 'Kusa Zoshi' (illustrated story books), the distinction between 'Kana Zoshi' and 'Ukiyo Zoshi' was not made until later.

sen.j: 元禄期、大坂を中心に流行し、民衆生活の幅広い主題を扱って多くの作品が書かれた（浮世には世間一般という意味と、色事、好色といった意味がある）。
sen.e: During the Genroku era, it became popular centering around Osaka and many works were written on wide variety of common people's lives (Ukiyo means not only world in general but love affair and amorous).

sen.j: 京都の八文字屋から出版されたものは特に「八文字屋本（はちもんじやぼん）」と呼び、元禄から18世紀中頃の明和期まで刊行された。
sen.e: The books published by the Hachimonjiya (the bookstore) in Kyoto were especially called 'Hachimonjiya-bon' (books published by the Hachimonjiya), which were published during the period from the Genroku era to the Meiwa era in the mid-18th century.

sen.e: The accomplishment of Saikaku to be referred to as the founder is the most famous and, except some works including "Seken musuko katagi" (Characters of ｗorldly young men), "Seken musume yoshi" (looks of ｗorldly young women) of Kiseki EJIMA, there were small number of famous works published after that.
